p:
The electrochemical method was used to determine the AOA [ 41]. The experiment’s methodology consists in taking voltamperogram of cathodic electroreduction of oxygen using the “Analyst AOA” (RU.C.31.113.A N28715), connected to a PC. The AOA of the tested samples (extracts obtained with different solvents as described in 4.5.) was calculated according to kinetic criterion K (in micromoles per litre·minute) indicating the quantity of the reactive oxygen species in time, compared to the trolox kinetic criterion and expressed as:
(1)
A O A =
K
s a m p l e
K
t r o l o x
